questions.question_text: Within which cache timeline do the Webex App endpoints perform a STUN test to calculate round-trip delay time to available media node clusters?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
The answer is B

Answer: B
Cisco video endpoints registered to Webex along with the Webex App (without the Full Featured Webex Experience) can find the Video Mesh nodes automatically when doing a 1:1 meeting or a multi-participant Webex meeting. There is a process built into the Software called “Cluster Reachability” that will perform a latency test to the Video Mesh cluster(s) on the corporate network and to the cloud Webex media resources. At the point of startup, network change, or cache expiration which is every 2 hours, the video endpoint or application will ask Webex for a list of media resources that are candidates for the video endpoint or application to use as a media resource.

https://www.cisco.com/c/dam/en/us/td/docs/solutions/PA/WbxEdge/PAEdgeVMN.pdf.

Selected Answer: C
The answer is C. 4 hours.

Webex App endpoints perform a STUN test to calculate round-trip delay time to available media node clusters every 4 hours. This ensures that the endpoints are always using the best possible media node cluster for their connection.

A STUN test is a simple way to measure the round-trip delay time between two endpoints. It works by sending a message from one endpoint to the other and then measuring the time it takes for the message to return. This information can then be used to calculate the round-trip delay time between the two endpoints.

The round-trip delay time is an important factor in determining the quality of a media connection. A high round-trip delay time can cause audio and video to be choppy and out of sync. By performing a STUN test every 4 hours, Webex App endpoints can ensure that they are always using the best possible media node cluster for their connection. This helps to improve the quality of the media connection and the overall user experience.

Selected Answer: A
Correct Answer:
A. Deploy Directory Connector

Deploying the Directory Connector allows for the synchronization of user directories, which is crucial for integrating on-premises collaboration systems with Webex cloud services. This ensures that users can access Webex services using their existing enterprise credentials and identities.

D. Referring to the Cisco Espressway Connector is only integrating the messaging service, so that users on-prem and cloud can communicate.


Table 1 Components of the Preferred Architecture for Cisco Webex Hybrid Services
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/solutions/PA/overview/12x/hybpa12x.html

Also check this:
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/voice_ip_comm/cloudCollaboration/spark/hybridservices/messageservice/cmgt_b_spark-hybrid-message-deployment-guide/cmgt_b_spark-hybrid-message-deployment-guide_chapter_01.html#reference_70B0448420E38BCC16157784D9341D14

Answer is D

Hybrid Messageconnects your Unified Communications Manager IM and Presence Service(IM and Presence Service) to Webex to enable interoperability with Webex App.

The Hybrid Messageenables interoperability between these two groups of users. The components that make Hybrid message possible are the message connector, hosted on Cisco Expressway infrastructure on your premises, and the Message Service, running in the Webexcloud. 

https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/voice_ip_comm/cloudCollaboration/spark/hybridservices/messageservice/cmgt_b_spark-hybrid-message-deployment-guide/cmgt_b_spark-hybrid-message-deployment-guide_chapter_00.html

Directory Connector only Sync directory between on-premise and cloud.

Selected Answer: A
Cisco Directory Connector Synchronizes Microsoft Active Directory users into Webex
Control Hub (creating, updating, deleting) so that user account information is always current in the cloud.

Selected Answer: A
A is correct

comments.content: in the official cert guide there is no place where it's mentioned " Expressway Message Connector "

Because the interop with the webex app implies the existence of a Cisco Jabber deployment and to make that happen, the Webex Hybrid Message Service must be enabled, which requires the Cisco Expressway Message Connector host to be deployed.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
The correct answer is D. Deploy a Cisco Expressway Message Connector host.

questions.question_text: A company has an on-premises Cisco collaboration cluster that contains Cisco UCM, IM and Presence, and Cisco Webex in the cloud. The company wants to integrate the on-premises infrastructure with Webex to enable interoperability with the Webex App. An engineer already configured the cluster in Cisco UCM, IM and Presence, and the organization in the Webex Control Hub. Which action must the engineer take to complete the configuration?

choices.D: Deploy a Cisco Expressway Message Connector host.
choices.B: Open the TCP 443 port from IM and Presence to Webex Cloud.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
Workflow for a Cloud Deployment using Cisco Webex Messenger
Step 1 Configure Policies
Step 2 Create Users for Cloud Deployment
Step 3 Set Up Certificate Validation
Step 4 Configure the Clients
Step 5 Deploy Cisco Jabber Applications and Jabber Softphone for VDI

questions.question_text: Which action is required when using Cisco Jabber for Cloud with Cisco Webex Messenger?

choices.C: Configure service discovery for remote access.

choices.D: to the call control environment (Unified CM or Expressway)
choices.A: On-premises endpoints cannot participate in Cisco Webex Video Mesh

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
On-premises SIP endpoints send signaling to the call control environment (Unified CM or Expressway), which then sends it to the Video Mesh node. Media is sent to the transcoding service.

https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/voice_ip_comm/cloudCollaboration/wbxt/videomesh/cmgt_b_webex-video-mesh-deployment-guide/cmgt_b_hybrid-media-deployment-guide_chapter_010.html

questions.question_text: During the deployment of a Cisco Webex Video Mesh, where do on-premises SIP endpoints send signaling?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
D. Using the Directory Connector, room resources without Webex licenses can be synchronized with Webex to make the room appear in the phonebook of the Webex App or the endpoint. SIP address is then entered from Control Hub because it will not match the field.

This is the most accurate option. It allows synchronization of rooms without Webex licenses and acknowledges that the SIP address might need to be manually configured in Control Hub.

By using the Directory Connector to synchronize room resources and manually configuring the SIP address in Control Hub if necessary, you can ensure that the SIP addresses of legacy video endpoints appear in the Webex directory listings.

Selected Answer: A
Answer is A, no license is needed to sync on premise rooms in control hub (except for webex subscription)

https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/voice_ip_comm/cloudCollaboration/spark/hybridservices/directoryconnector/cmgt_b_directory-connector-guide-admins/cmgt_b_directory-connector-guide-admins_chapter_01001.html

choices.B: Using the Directory Connector, room resources with flex licenses only can be synchronized with Webex to make the room appear in the phonebook of the Webex App or the endpoint. SIP address is then entered from Control Hub because it will not match the field.
choices.D: Using the Directory Connector, room resources without Webex licenses can be synchronized with Webex to make the room appear in the phonebook of the Webex App or the endpoint. SIP address is then entered from Control Hub because it will not match the field.
choices.A: Using the Directory Connector, room resources without Webex licenses can be synchronized with Webex to make the SIP address appear in the phonebook of the Webex App or the endpoint.
choices.C: Using the Directory Connector, room resources with flex licenses only can be synchronized with Webex to make the SIP address appear in the phonebook of the Webex App or the endpoint.

questions.question_text: A company is implementing Cisco Webex but has existing legacy Cisco video endpoint registered on-premises. The administrator of Webex wants the SIP address of these rooms to appear in the directory listing on Webex registered endpoints and in the Webex App. How can this be configured?
